00022 /**
00023  * @file   AnalysisStreamExpression.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Mon Feb 13 10:18:56 2006
00026  * 
00027  * @brief AnalysisStream class specialized for quantification methods that are
00028  * used for mRNA expression genechips like the ubiquitous U133 human chip. 
00029  */
00030 
00031 #ifndef _ANALYSISSTREAMEXPRESSION_H_
00032 #define _ANALYSISSTREAMEXPRESSION_H_
00033 
00034 #include "chipstream/AnalysisStream.h"
00035 #include "chipstream/QuantExprMethod.h"
00036 //
00037 #include "util/Util.h"
00038 //
00039 #include <set>
00040 //
00041 
00042 
00043 class AnalysisStreamExpression : public AnalysisStream {
00044 
00045 public:
00046   /** 
00047    * Constructor.
00048    * @param doGenoTypes - Do we want to process genotyping probesets.
00049    * @param doStrand - Do we want to break out genotyping probesets by
00050    * strand in addition to allele?
00051    */
00052   AnalysisStreamExpression(bool doGenoTypes=false, bool doStrand=false, bool aOnly=false);
00053 
00054   /** 
00055    * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00056    * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00057    */
00058   static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions();
00059 
00060   /** 
00061    * Fill in the information for Self documentation.
00062    * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00063    */
00064   static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc);
00065 
00066   QuantExprMethod *getQuantExprMethod();
00067 
00068   /** 
00069    * Set the object for summarizing an individual probe set.
00070    * @param qMethod - Quantification object.
00071    */
00072   void setQuantMethod(QuantMethod *qMethod);
00073 
00074   /** 
00075    * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00076    * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00077    * @return SelfDoc
00078    */
00079   static SelfDoc explainSelf();
00080   
00081   /** 
00082    * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00083    * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00084    * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00085    * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00086    * 
00087    * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00088    * 
00089    * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00090    */
00091   static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param);
00092 
00093   /** 
00094    * Fill in psNewGroup with probes from psGroup based on the block
00095    * indexes in the blocks vector. To divide a genotyping probeset
00096    * based on Allele (A or B) you would use the 1,3 blocks for A and
00097    * 2,4 blocks for B. If you just want one strand of a particular
00098    * allele then it would be 1 for A+, 2 for B+, 3 for A- and 4 for
00099    * B-. This is sensitive to the vagaries of the genotyping probeset
00100    * structure which is poorly documented and ever
00101    * "innovating"... Eventually this should be moved to the ChipLayout
00102    * class or ProbeSet class.
00103    * 
00104    * @param psNewGroup 
00105    * @param psGroup 
00106    * @param blocks 
00107    */
00108   void fillInProbeSetFromBlocks(ProbeSetGroup &psNewGroup, ProbeSetGroup &psGroup,
00109                                 const std::vector<short> &blocks);
00110 
00111   void fillInGroup(ProbeSetGroup &psAllele, ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, int blockIx, const char *basename, const char *suffix);
00112 
00113   /** 
00114    * Do the analysis for a particular group of probe sets. If we see a
00115    * genotype probeset and user wishes it try to break it up into
00116    * expression probesets. The code for dividing up a genotyping
00117    * probeset should probably live in ChipLayout eventually, but for
00118    * now the initial implementation is here.
00119    * 
00120    * @param psGroup - Collection of probe sets to get probes from.
00121    * @param iMart - Object containing raw data values for all chips.
00122    * @param doReport - Should the quantification report object be called?
00123    * 
00124    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00125    */
00126   virtual bool doAnalysis(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, IntensityMart &iMart, bool doReport, bool alleleSummaryOnly = false);
00127 
00128   /** 
00129    * Make a new probeset group which is a subset of the original based on the
00130    * probeset ids contained in the goodIds set.
00131    * 
00132    * @param selectGroup - New probeset group to be filled in.
00133    * @param goodIds - Set with ids of probes to keep.
00134    * @param psGroup - Original probeset to get probes and structure from.
00135    */
00136   static void makeSelectProbesetGroup(ProbeSetGroup &selectGroup, 
00137                                       std::set<probeid_t> &goodIds,
00138                                       ProbeSetGroup &psGroup);
00139 private:
00140   QuantExprMethod *m_QExprMethod;
00141   bool m_DoGenotypes; ///< Should we break genotyping probesets into different alleles and summarize them?
00142   bool m_DoStrand; ///< Should we separate genotyping probesets by strand in addition to block
00143   bool m_Aonly; ///< Should only the A allele be processed for
00144                 ///genotyping probesets? Useful for pm adjuster pm-sum
00145                 ///where A and B allele give exact same results.
00146 };
00147 
00148 #endif /* _ANALYSISSTREAMEXPRESSION_H_ */
